intro: Pleurandra parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pleurandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and glossy, while the flowers are small and white, clustered around the spadix. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
